name: 4-7-8 Breathing
description: Dr. Weil's relaxation technique: inhale 4, hold 7, exhale 8.
explanation: The extended exhale activates the parasympathetic nervous system, promoting deep relaxation and better sleep.
when_to_use: Before sleep, to reduce anxiety, or when you need to calm down quickly.

round_messages.text: Inhale through your nose, hold, then exhale completely through your mouth.
Focus on the long exhale - this is where the magic happens.

pre_session.text: Place the tip of your tongue against the ridge behind your upper teeth.
You'll exhale through your mouth around your tongue.

on_start.text: Start with a complete exhale, then begin the 4-7-8 pattern.

on_end.text: Perfect! You should feel noticeably more relaxed.
This technique gets more effective with practice.

cautions: Start with 4 cycles maximum - this technique can be very powerful.
Don't exceed 8 cycles until you're experienced.
Normal to feel slightly lightheaded at first.
